metadata.Title: CVE-2020-9281 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the HTML Data Processor for CKEditor 4.0 before 4.14 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script through a crafted "protected" comment (with the cke_protected syntax).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ckeditor - 4.16.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ckeditor package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.16.2+dfsg-1').
